symptoms: dyspnea with normal pulmonary function tests

diagnoses: Anemia (e.g., iron deficiency anemia, vitamin B12 deficiency)
Other viral infections (e.g., cytomegalovirus, Epstein-Barr virus)
Leukopenia (needs further investigation to determine underlying cause)
Mood disorder (such as Bipolar Disorder or Borderline Personality Disorder)
Epistaxis (needs further investigation to determine underlying cause)
Cancer (rare but important to rule out)
Gastrointestinal Disorders (e.g., Crohns Disease, Ulcerative Colitis)
Primary immunodeficiency disorders (e.g., Common Variable Immunodeficiency (CVID), X-linked agammaglobulinemia)
Autoimmune diseases (e.g., Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE), Rheumatoid arthritis)
Genetic disorders (e.g., Ehlers-Danlos syndromes, Down syndrome)
Metabolic disorders (e.g., Copper deficiency, Vitamin B12 deficiency)
Mast cell activation disorders (e.g., Mastocytosis, MCAS)
Substance abuse (e.g., laxative abuse, thyroid hormone abuse)
Infectious diarrhea (consider parasites for chronic diarrhea and travel history)
Autoimmune disorders (e.g., Graves disease for hyperthyroidism, celiac disease for diarrhea)
Neurological disorders (e.g., epilepsy, but less likely with pseudoseizures)
Gastrointestinal disorders (e.g., irritable bowel syndrome, inflammatory bowel disease)
